title: Tata Curvv Dark Edition price starts from Rs 16.49 lakh
description: The Tata Curvv now has a Dark Edition just like the Safari, Nexon and Harrier SUVs, and it is priced between Rs 16.49 lakh and Rs 19.52 lakh, ex-showroom, Mumbai. Tata Motors has launched the blacked-out version of the Curvv SUV amid the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL), where it stands as the official car of the tournament. Curvv Dark Edition is based on the top-spec Accomplished trim Gets 'DARK' badging on the fenders; all-black upholstery Tata Curvv Dark Edition: price and engine options 1.2-litre GDI petrol and 1.5-litre diesel engine options As said in our previous report, the Dark Edition will be solely available in the range-topping Curvv Accomplished trim, which can be had with either a 1.2-litre direct injection turbo-petrol engine that makes 125hp, 225Nm or a 1.5-litre diesel engine with an output of 118hp, 260Nm. Both engines can be paired with a 6-speed manual or a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. Exterior Besides a new Carbon Black paint courtesy of the Dark Edition, an all-black treatment has been given to the bumpers, grille and 18-inch alloy wheels. The Curvv coupe SUV continues to get full-width LED light bars front and back, and gloss black cladding on the wheel arches. Interior On the inside, Tata has applied the black theme to the leatherette upholstery, centre console and roof liner. Features on offer are include a nine-speaker JBL sound system, wireless charger, panoramic sunroof, ventilated front seats, reclining rear seats, air purifier, disc brakes for all wheels and six airbags. A 12.3-inch touchscreen, Amazon Alexa, ADAS suite and gesture-controlled tailgate are additional features available with the Curvv Accomplished+ A variant. html:
Based on the top-spec Accomplished trim, the Curvv Dark models carry a premium of up to Rs 32,000.

The Tata Curvv now has a Dark Edition just like the Safari, Nexon and Harrier SUVs, and it is priced between Rs 16.49 lakh and Rs 19.52 lakh, ex-showroom, Mumbai. Tata Motors has launched the blacked-out version of the Curvv SUV amid the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL), where it stands as the official car of the tournament.

  1. Curvv Dark Edition is based on the top-spec Accomplished trim
  2. Gets 'DARK' badging on the fenders; all-black upholstery

Tata Curvv Dark Edition: price and engine options

1.2-litre GDI petrol and 1.5-litre diesel engine options

As said in our previous report, the Dark Edition will be solely available in the range-topping Curvv Accomplished trim, which can be had with either a 1.2-litre direct injection turbo-petrol engine that makes 125hp, 225Nm or a 1.5-litre diesel engine with an output of 118hp, 260Nm. Both engines can be paired with a 6-speed manual or a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission.

Tata Curvv Dark Edition Price list (ex-showroom, Mumbai)

Curvv Accomplished + A petrol DCA19.4919.1732,000
Curvv Accomplished + A diesel DCA19.5219.2032,000

Tata Curvv Dark Edition: what’s new?

Exterior

Besides a new Carbon Black paint courtesy of the Dark Edition, an all-black treatment has been given to the bumpers, grille and 18-inch alloy wheels. The Curvv coupe SUV continues to get full-width LED light bars front and back, and gloss black cladding on the wheel arches.

Interior

On the inside, Tata has applied the black theme to the leatherette upholstery, centre console and roof liner. Features on offer are include a nine-speaker JBL sound system, wireless charger, panoramic sunroof, ventilated front seats, reclining rear seats, air purifier, disc brakes for all wheels and six airbags. A 12.3-inch touchscreen, Amazon Alexa, ADAS suite and gesture-controlled tailgate are additional features available with the Curvv Accomplished+ A variant.
